Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <joe2x4> Hey guys, I'm just trying to add a few suggestions.

Is adding merge mining an option. I know various older coins have played with that type of thing. Though I believe that even on those, hash rate has historicaly declined with out new coin reward. Too bad Komodo miners couldn't merge mine chips.

The profit switcher seems more of an attack. If the attack is really only feasible till chips takes off, what would be the cost to add hash till chips is seeing more demand? 
Maybe POS Chips? What do other coins do to protect against this issue?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <un Haiduc> profit switching isn't an "attack", it's just a fact of profitable mining multiple coins for miners

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <blackjok3r> Profit switching is only a problem for low hash rate coins. Chips has dPoW so doesnt need a massive hash rate. And its dicciculty algo isnt great either. Must be straight BTC clone, but adjusted faster I think. I have been advised not to try anduse dgw v3 diff adjustment now either, it has attack vectors too.
